isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - ENGINE CRANK INHIBIT SYSTEM (ECI) - SIGNAL FUNCTION

svcproc.title: SIGNAL FUNCTION
svcproc.para: The Engine Crank Inhibit feature of the ECM is used to control the operation of the cranking motor. The ECM prevents the cranking motor from being engaged when the engine is running. The transmission neutral safety switch or clutch switch will prevent the cranking motor from being engaged when the transmission is in gear or when the clutch pedal is not depressed.
